contents.question: I have recurring memories of painful experiences.
I am unable to stop a harmful childhood pattern.
I sometimes obsess about people who have hurt me and are now gone.
I feel bad at times about myself because of shameful experiences I believe were my fault.
I am a risk taker.
At times, I have difficulty staying awake.
I sometimes feel separate from my body as a reaction to a flashback or memory.
I deny myself basic needs at times, like groceries, shoes, books, medical care, rent and heat.
I have distressing dreams about experiences.
I repeat painful experiences over and over.
I try to be understood by those who are incapable or don’t care for me.
I have suicidal thoughts.
I engage in high-risk behaviors.
I eat excessively to avoid problems.
I avoid thoughts or feelings associated with my trauma experiences.
I skip vacations because of lack of time or money.
I have periods of sleeplessness.
I try to re-create an early trauma experience.
I keep secrets for people who have hurt me.
I have attempted suicide.
I am sexual when frightened.
I drink to excess when life is too hard.
I avoid stories, parts of movies or reminders of early painful experiences.
I avoid sexual pleasure.
I sometimes feel like an old painful experience is happening now.
There is something destructive I do over and over from my early life.
I stayed in conflict with someone when I could have walked away.
I have suicidal thoughts.
I often feel sexual when I am lonely.
I use depressant drugs as a way to cope.
I am unable to recall important details of painful experiences.
I avoid doing “normal” activities because of fears I have.
I have sudden, vivid or distracting memories of painful experiences.
I attempt to stop activities I know are not helpful.
I go overboard to help people who have been destructive.
I often feel lonely and estranged from others because of painful experiences I have had.
I feel intensely sexual when violence occurs.
My procrastinating interferes with my life activities.
I sometimes withdraw or have no interest in important activities because of childhood experiences.
I will hoard money and not spend money on legitimate needs.
I am upset when there are reminders of abusive experiences like anniversaries, places or symbols.
I compulsively do things to others that were done to me as a young person.
I sometimes help those who continue to harm me.
I feel unable to experience certain emotions (love, happiness, sadness, etc.).
I feel sexual when degraded or used.
Sleep is a way for me to avoid life’s problems.
I have difficulty concentrating.
I have attempted diets repeatedly.
I have difficulty sleeping.
My relationships are the same story over and over.
I feel loyal to people even though they have betrayed me.
I have a dim outlook on my future.
I feel sexual when someone is 'nice' to me.
At times I am preoccupied with food and eating.
I experience confusion often.
I refuse to buy things even when I need them and have the money.
I have difficulty feeling sexual.
I know that something destructive I do repeats a childhood event.
I remain a “team” member when obviously things are becoming destructive.
I feel as if I must avoid depending on people.
I sometimes feel bad because I enjoyed experiences that were exploitive of me.
I abuse alcohol often.
I tend to be accident-prone.
I spend much time performing underachieving jobs.
Sometimes I have outbursts of anger or irritability.
I do things to others that were done to me in my family.
I make repeated efforts to convince people who were destructive to me and not willing to listen.
I engage in self-destructive behaviors.
I get “high” on activities that are dangerous to me.
I use TV, reading and hobbies as ways to numb out.
I go into a fantasy world when things are tough.
I am underemployed.
I am extremely cautious of my surroundings.
I have thoughts and behaviors repeatedly that do not feel good to me.
I attempt to be liked by people who clearly are exploiting me.
I engage in self-mutilating behaviors (cutting self, burning, bruising, etc.).
I use drugs like cocaine or amphetamines to speed things up
I put off certain tasks.
I use “romance” as a way to avoid problems.
I feel very guilty about any sexual activity.
I often feel that people are out to take advantage of me.
I revert to doing things I did as a child.
I am attracted to untrustworthy people.
I endure physical or emotional pain most people would not accept.
I like “living on the edge” of danger or excitement.
When things are difficult, I will sometimes binge.
I have a tendency to be preoccupied with something other than what I need to be.
I have a low interest in sexual activity.
I am distrustful of others.
Some of my recurring behavior comes from early life experiences.
I trust people who have proved to be unreliable.
I try to be perfect.
I am orgasmic when hurt or beaten.
I use drugs to escape.
I use marijuana or psychedelics to hallucinate.
I sometimes spoil success opportunities.
I am startled more easily than others.
I am preoccupied with children of a certain age.
I seek people whom I know will cause me pain.
I avoid mistakes at any cost.
I love to gamble on outcomes.
I work too hard so I won’t have to feel.
I will often lose myself in fantasies rather than deal with real life.
I go without necessities for periods of time.
I get physical reactions to reminders of abuse experiences (breaking out in cold sweat, trouble breathing, etc.).
I engage in abusive relationships repeatedly.
I have difficulty distancing myself from unhealthy relationships.
I sometimes want to hurt myself physically.
I need lots of stimulation so I will not be bored.
I get 'lost' in my work.
I live a 'double life.'
I vomit food or use diuretics to avoid weight gain.
I feel anxious about being sexual.
There is a certain age of children or adolescents that is sexually attractive to me.
I continue to have contact with a person who has abused me.
I often feel unworthy, unlovable, immoral or sinful because of experiences I have had.
I like sex when it is dangerous.
I try to 'slow down' my mind.
I like “compartments” that others do not know about.
I experience periods when I’m not interested in eating.
I am scared about sex.
There are activities that I have trouble stopping even though they are useless or destructive.
I am in emotional fights (divorces, lawsuits) that seem endless.
I often feel I should be punished for past behavior.
I do sexual things that are risky.
When I am anxious, I will do things to stop my feelings.
I have a fantasy life that I retreat to when things are hard.
I have difficulty with play.
I wake up with upsetting dreams.
My relationships seem to have the same dysfunctional pattern.
There are certain people whom I always allow to take advantage of me.
I have a sense that others are always better off than me.
I use cocaine or amphetamines to heighten high-risk activities.
I don’t tolerate uncomfortable feelings.
I am a daydreamer.
At times, I see comfort, luxuries and play activities as frivolous.
I hate it when someone approaches me sexually.
Sometimes I find children more attractive than others.
There are some people in my life who are hard to get over, though they hurt or used me badly.
I feel bad when something good happens.
I get excited/aroused when faced with dangerous situations.
I use anything to distract myself from my problems.
Sometimes I live in an 'unreal' world.
There are long periods of time with no sexual activity for me.
